content: I hope I got the proper term right when it comes to the title; if they have cruise missiles as opposed to SLBMs, the subs are classified as SSGNs instead of SSBNs or just SSNs? (G for guided missiles?) ++http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/asiapcf/03/28/russian.subs/index.html quote: Russia to build 6 nuclear subs with cruise missiles MOSCOW, Russia (CNN) -- Russia will build at least six nuclear-powered submarines with long-range cruise missiles for its navy, a source in the Russian Defense Ministry told the Itar-Tass news agency. The missiles can potentially carry low-capacity tactical warheads, the news agency reported Friday. (...) The source added, "Despite the construction of a new nuclear submarine with new missiles, Russia intends to observe firmly international arms control agreements on equal terms with other countries." [B]The Severodvinsk-class submarines are being built at the Sevmash shipyard, the center of Russian nuclear submarine production, according to Global Security's Web site. The new subs will be put into service for the Russian navy in 2011, the source told Itar-Tass. Russia will finance the construction of the new submarine with long-range cruise missiles, First Deputy Chief of the Navy's General Staff, Vice-Admiral Oleg Burtsev told Itar-Tass. [/B]
quote: Russia to build 6 nuclear subs with cruise missiles MOSCOW, Russia (CNN) -- Russia will build at least six nuclear-powered submarines with long-range cruise missiles for its navy, a source in the Russian Defense Ministry told the Itar-Tass news agency. The missiles can potentially carry low-capacity tactical warheads, the news agency reported Friday. (...) The source added, "Despite the construction of a new nuclear submarine with new missiles, Russia intends to observe firmly international arms control agreements on equal terms with other countries." [B]The Severodvinsk-class submarines are being built at the Sevmash shipyard, the center of Russian nuclear submarine production, according to Global Security's Web site. The new subs will be put into service for the Russian navy in 2011, the source told Itar-Tass. Russia will finance the construction of the new submarine with long-range cruise missiles, First Deputy Chief of the Navy's General Staff, Vice-Admiral Oleg Burtsev told Itar-Tass. [/B]

content: quote: Originally posted by Knele: They’ve taken notice of our use of Tomahawks…….. Its an ability the Russian Navy covets and very much wants for itself especially when China, India and other nations are rapidly building up submarine forces. Russian cruise missiles are not as advanced as US ones due to the lack of real time trial and error in combat. They are making headway though...
quote: Originally posted by Knele: They’ve taken notice of our use of Tomahawks……..

content: quote: Originally posted by sw614: SSGNs. Heck Russia has built a few before. Wasn't the Kursk considered a SSGN? Heck we converted 4 Ohios into SSGNs with what, 156 TLAMs each? yes, the Kursk was a SSGN with 24 anti ship cruise missiles and 24 torpedoes.
